paper_abstract: Let K be an ordinary differential field with derivation partial derivative. Let P be a system of n linear differential polynomial parametric equations in n - 1 differential parameters, with implicit ideal ID. Given a nonzero linear differential polynomial A in ID, we give necessary and sufficient conditions on A for P to be n - 1 dimensional. We prove the existence of a linear perturbation P(phi) of P, so that the linear complete differential resultant partial derivative CRes(phi), associated to P(phi), is nonzero. A nonzero linear differential polynomial in ID is obtained, from the lowest degree term of partial derivative CRes(phi), and used to provide an implicitization for P. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A perturbed differential resultant based implicitization algorithm for linear DPPEs
